Package gui

Class MenuUIController

java.lang.Object
gui.MenuUIController
public class MenuUIController extends Object
Controller class for the main menu UI. Provides functionality for navigating various features of the application based on user permissions.

  • Method Details

    • initializeButtons

      private void initializeButtons()
      Initializes button visibility and functionality based on user permissions.

    • initialize

      private void initialize(User.UserType permission, String name)
      Initializes the controller with the specified user type and name.
      Parameters:
      permission - the user type of the logged-in user.
      name - the name of the logged-in user.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, User.UserType permission, String name) throws IOException
      Starts the menu UI stage and initializes it with user details.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the primary stage for the menu UI.
      permission - the user type of the logged-in user.
      name - the name of the logged-in user.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error loading the FXML file.

    • getReportBtn

      private void getReportBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the "Report" button click event. Loads the report frame into the menu pane.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by the button click.

    • getManagerBtn

      private void getManagerBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the "Manager" button click event. Loads the subscriber manager frame.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by the button click.

    • getLogoutBtn

      private void getLogoutBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the "Logout" button click event. Logs out the user and displays the logout confirmation screen.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by the button click.

    • loadFXMLIntoPane

      IController loadFXMLIntoPane(String fxmlFile)
      Loads a new FXML file into the menu pane and returns its controller.
      Parameters:
      fxmlFile - the path to the FXML file.
      Returns:
      the controller of the loaded FXML, if it implements IController.

    • setPaneTitle

      public void setPaneTitle(String title)
      Sets the title of the pane in the menu UI.
      Parameters:
      title - the title to be displayed in the pane.
